Question: This person died in his sleep in London on 20 March 1727 (OS 20 March 1726; NS 31 March 1727) and was buried in Westminster Abbey.
Hints: This person showed instead that all that was needed was an inward attraction from the Sun.
This person's work has been said "to distinctly advance every branch of mathematics then studied".
This abruptly ended in 1693, and at the same time this person suffered a nervous breakdown.
